text:
Hey, is it possible to install npm packages for the React CRM Card? It does not work for me at all.

Do we need to bundle them other than using the npm i package-name?
lol I was like "what is UIE!?"

Hi all. I'm trying to separate some code in one of my serverless functions. I've created a new function and it's registered in serverless.json (though it's not called from the front end). I have a module.exports in that file that exports the function I'm after. I require that function in my other serverless script. It works perfectly on local dev but not on production. Anyone know what I'm doing wrong? Is this not possible in production?
Quick one - is there a way to set the “Private App Icon” when the Private App is created through a UI Extension Project?
Agree. Some components come with built-in tooltip functionality.. buuuut I have also seen an experimental ToolTip element, so it might arrive at some point :slightly_smiling_face:
AFAIK it needs to exist in the same file. I’m very interested in re-using and breaking down serverless scripts as well :stuck_out_tongue:
I’d recommend going over <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/platform/create-ui-extensions|this guide> or using the one in your “Developer” section of your portal.
Hi Magnus, unfortunately we dont currently support custom icons for private apps

Thanks Roger! :raised_hands:
Would be a nice-to-have request from our side :wink:

In case you missed it, bumping up <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C05R599UA12/p1724950351252999|this thread again> for the upcoming *Charts component*. It's a great way to have a say in how data is visualized on the App Card. Some screenshots below. Reply in the thread if you'd like to be a part of the Alpha :slightly_smiling_face:

Hey everyone. Has anyone figured out a decent caching strategy for serverless functions? I’m making api calls and I’d love to cache the results somewhere if I can and cut down on calls. I’ve tried several npm packages for caching and it seems that none of them work in the HubSpot environment.
